answerText: fine structure constant[10] The fine structure constant is the coupling constant for this fundamental force. Salam, Gashow, and Weinberg worked on unifying it with the weak force.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 20 | 7 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This constant was first introduced by Arnold Sommerfeld. For 10 points each: [10] Name this dimensionless quantity that is sometimes expressed as the product of the Coulomb constant and the square of the elementary charge over h-bar times the speed of light. Its magnitude is approximately 1/137.
